newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore June gas oil breaks $25/bbl support.
newsitem.headline: Singapore June gas oil breaks $25/bbl support.

text.p: Singapore physical gas oil price broke the long-term support of $25.00 per barrel on Friday when a Swiss trader sold a 150,000-barrel cargo to a Japanese trader at $24.90, traders said.
The cargo is for June 7-11 lifting, free-on-board (fob) Singapore basis.
This is the first time prompt gas oil has traded below $25.00 since August last year when it traded at $24.45 per barrel.

Following the first deal below the $25.00-mark, two more gas oil cargoes traded at $24.90 per barrel for a later date range--June 18-22. One cargo was sold by a Mediterranean trader to a Singapore trader and the other by a European major to a Japanese trader.
Two other physical cargoes were traded earlier on Friday, with a Japanese trader buying the cargoes from a European major at $25.00 for June 7-11 and June 18-22 liftings fob.
Traders said the low levels traded underscored the bearish physical gas oil market with as many as eight offers seen on Friday.
They said the next support level for prompt gas oil is seen at $24.50 per barrel.
Singapore is flushed with gas oil as reflected by the at least three-year high middle-distillates stocks level of 10.345 million barrels for the week ended June 21, the Trade Development Board said.
The market is also haunted by high stocks in China and Hong Kong as well as port congestions which are slowing China's imports.
Indonesia's appetite for June was also limited, with some traders estimating it at only 2.4 million barrels, after buying more than four million barrels each month in recent months.
Swaps gas oil was also under pressure with the lowest traded level at $24.85 per barrel, brokers said.
